name: SubstanceSourceMaterial
description: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex.

properties.name: SubstanceSourceMaterial
properties.short: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex

properties.name: id
properties.short: Logical id of this artifact
properties.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
properties.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

properties.name: meta
properties.short: Metadata about the resource
properties.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

properties.name: implicitRules
properties.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
properties.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
properties.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

properties.name: language
properties.short: Language of the resource content
properties.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
properties.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

properties.name: text
properties.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
properties.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
properties.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

properties.name: contained
properties.short: Contained, inline Resources
properties.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
properties.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

properties.name: extension
properties.short: Additional content defined by implementations
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: sourceMaterialClass
properties.short: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material
properties.definition: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material.

properties.name: sourceMaterialType
properties.short: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent
properties.definition: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent.

properties.name: sourceMaterialState
properties.short: The state of the source material when extracted
properties.definition: The state of the source material when extracted.

properties.name: organismId
properties.short: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified
properties.definition: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified.

properties.name: organismName
properties.short: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy
properties.definition: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy.

properties.name: parentSubstanceId
properties.short: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)
properties.definition: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant).

properties.name: parentSubstanceName
properties.short: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation
properties.definition: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

properties.name: countryOfOrigin
properties.short: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate
properties.definition: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate.

properties.name: geographicalLocation
properties.short: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat
properties.definition: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat.

properties.name: developmentStage
properties.short: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)
properties.definition: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum).

properties.name: fractionDescription
properties.short: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels
properties.definition: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels.

properties.name: fraction
properties.short: This element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation
properties.definition: This element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation.

properties.name: materialType
properties.short: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1
properties.definition: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1.

properties.name: organism
properties.short: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf
properties.definition: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf.

properties.name: family
properties.short: The family of an organism shall be specified
properties.definition: The family of an organism shall be specified.

properties.name: genus
properties.short: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies
properties.definition: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies.

properties.name: species
properties.short: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies
properties.definition: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies.

properties.name: intraspecificType
properties.short: The Intraspecific type of an organism shall be specified
properties.definition: The Intraspecific type of an organism shall be specified.

properties.name: intraspecificDescription
properties.short: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention
properties.definition: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention.

properties.name: authorType
properties.short: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. The parenthetical author of an organism species refers to the first author who published the plant/animal name (of any rank). The primary author of an organism species refers to the first author(s), who validly published the plant/animal name
properties.definition: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. The parenthetical author of an organism species refers to the first author who published the plant/animal name (of any rank). The primary author of an organism species refers to the first author(s), who validly published the plant/animal name.

properties.name: authorDescription
properties.short: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank)
properties.definition: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank).

properties.name: maternalOrganismId
properties.short: The identifier of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal
properties.definition: The identifier of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal.

properties.short: The name of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal
properties.definition: The name of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal.

properties.short: The identifier of the paternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary

properties.name: paternalOrganismName
properties.short: The name of the paternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified
properties.definition: The name of the paternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified.

properties.name: hybridType
properties.short: The hybrid type of an organism shall be specified
properties.definition: The hybrid type of an organism shall be specified.

properties.name: part
properties.short: Entity of anatomical origin of source material within an organism
properties.definition: Entity of anatomical origin of source material within an organism.

properties.name: partLocation
properties.short: The detailed anatomic location when the part can be extracted from different anatomical locations of the organism. Multiple alternative locations may apply
properties.definition: The detailed anatomic location when the part can be extracted from different anatomical locations of the organism. Multiple alternative locations may apply.
